interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Connie And Carla
Review Date: 2015/09/28
Store: Nia Vardalos  (Actor),     Toni Collette  (Actor),     Michael Lembeck  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Universal Studios Home Entertainment, All Universal Studios Titles
Product Description: ['From the writer and star of My Big Fat Greek Wedding comes Connie and Carla, the hilarious new comedy the Chicago Sun-Times calls "a total delight!" Best friends Connie and Carla have always dreamed of fame and fortune, but their careers in show business are going nowhere fast. After witnessing a crime, they are forced to go on the run and keep their true identities secret. The dazzling duo stumble on an ingenious way to let their many talents shine. Now with a little luck–and lots of beauty products–they\'re going straight to the top, with plenty of side-splitting twists and turns along the way! Connie and Carla is an irresistible comedy-adventure filled with fun and loaded with laughter!Bonus Content:', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Bonus Musical Scenes', 'Bonus Musical Scenes', 'Outtakes', 'Outtakes', 'The Making of Connie and Carla', 'The Making of Connie and Carla', 'Dressing in Drag', 'Dressing in Drag', 'Debbie Reynolds', 'Debbie Reynolds']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Director': 'Michael Lembeck', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, Dubbed, DVD, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '1 hour and 48 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 17, 2004', 'Actors': 'Nia Vardalos, Toni Collette, David Duchovny, Debbie Reynolds', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (DTS 5.1), Unqualified', 'Studio': 'Universal Studios Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Hilarious film and decent casting make for a delightful romp.  Good viewing quality as well.
Review Title: Funny, funny, funny film!
Rating: 5.0

I got this as it had "one special night" on it.  I remembered it from tv a while back.  Still good as when first seen.  How nice to get two additional movies.  A great value for 3 for the price of one!
One truly special bargain

['From the writer and star of My Big Fat Greek Wedding comes Connie and Carla, the hilarious new comedy the Chicago Sun-Times calls "a total delight!" Best friends Connie and Carla have always dreamed of fame and fortune, but their careers in show business are going nowhere fast. After witnessing a crime, they are forced to go on the run and keep their true identities secret. The dazzling duo stumble on an ingenious way to let their many talents shine. Now with a little luck–and lots of beauty products–they\'re going straight to the top, with plenty of side-splitting twists and turns along the way! profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interests:** Movies, with a focus on family and holiday-themed films, particularly Christmas content and classic cinema.
- **Genre Preference:** Enjoys romantic comedies and family-friendly movies that evoke nostalgia, including classic dramas and light-hearted ghost tales.
- **Format Preference:** Prefers physical media, especially DVDs, which indicates a fondness for traditional viewing experiences that enhance enjoyment of classic films.
- **Value-Conscious:** Looks for value in purchases, seeking high-quality films with timeless appeal and emotional resonance, as demonstrated by positive reviews of engaging content.
- **Nostalgia Factor:** Strong inclination towards films that evoke personal memories and sentimental value, reflecting an emotional connection to vintage classics.
- **Positive Engagement:** Frequently rates films highly and shares positive reviews, suggesting an appreciation for quality entertainment that resonates emotionally and nostalgically.

Recent interactions indicate a broadening of comedy preferences, with a positive experience noted in a humorous film featuring robust casting and enjoyable viewing quality. The user continues to seek films that provide laughter and entertainment, reinforcing their desire for feel-good movies that resonate on both emotional and nostalgic levels, particularly during the holiday season.
